info.title: CE Admin APIs
info.summary: Comprehensive admin interface for managing your e-commerce platform
info.description: Complete administrative API suite for Commerce Engine, providing powerful tools to manage products, orders, customers, inventory, analytics, and system configuration. Designed for administrators and backend integrations requiring full platform control.

post.description: Retrive analytics data as per dynamic query passed.

event_detail.description: rows returned by raw query passed in request body.

post.description: Retrive data as per raw query passed.

data.description: rows returned by raw query passed in request body.

parameters.name: nested_level
parameters.description: to return categories upto specified nested level

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: commercengine id of a product, category, variant

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: commercengine id of a product, category, variant

post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a draft product by specifying its name and type. The product is created in its preliminary stage. All additional product details, including descriptions, pricing, and images, etc, can be updated using the Update Product API endpoint.
Deleting multiple products in single request.
Update specific fields of multiple products in single request.

category_id.description: if null value is passed, then categories will be removed from the specified products.

post.description: Retrieve products and variants inventory as per product ids and variant ids provided. To be used in S2S API call only.

warehouse_id.description: Optional: Provide array of warehouse id to check inventory for a specific warehouses.

put.description: This API endpoint allows for partial updates to product details, enabling you to modify specific attributes like pricing, descriptions, images, promotions, subscriptions, and more, without altering the entire product record. To optimize performance, please include only the fields that need updating. For fields that contain objects or arrays (e.g., shipping, promotions, images, pricing, categories, attributes, bundle_items, related_products), send the complete data for these fields, as the existing data will be replaced entirely.

post.description: Update shipping and packaging details of multiple variants.

get.description: List all customers who used the specified coupon at least once.
List all filter options for listing data.
Lists all inventory related activities of stock movements. This provides a comprehensive audit trail of inventory operations such as receiving, reservations, adjustments, transfers, and sales.
Retrieves inventory details for a specific product, product variant, or lot/batch based on the parameters provided.

parameters.description: lot batch of selected productor or variant.

get.description: Retrieves a printable receipt for a specific order using the order number. This endpoint returns either structured JSON data or a formatted PDF, suitable for customer presentation. Response format (JSON or PDF) is determined by an optional query parameter (e.g. format=pdf or format=json).

reference_number.description: multiple reference numbers are separated by comma.

bank_account_id.description: in case payment mode is bank-transfer

post.description: Generates a new verification code for pairing the specified POS device. This code is used to securely link the device with the system during the pairing process.

Disables the specified POS device, revoking its access to the system. This action updates the devices status to disabled, preventing it from performing any operations or connecting to the POS network.

get.description: Lists all inventory related activities of stock movements. This provides a comprehensive audit trail of inventory operations such as receiving, reservations, adjustments, transfers, and sales.
Retrieves inventory details for a specific product, product variant, or lot/batch based on the parameters provided.

parameters.description: lot batch of selected productor or variant.

get.description: Retrieves a printable receipt for a specific order using the order number. This endpoint returns either structured JSON data or a formatted PDF, suitable for customer presentation. Response format (JSON or PDF) is determined by an optional query parameter (e.g. format=pdf or format=json).

post.description: Create a segment. In case of dynamic segment, conditions field should accept only the json format specified. Proper validation message should be returned in case different jsob object is provided.

delete.description: Delete segment if not used in anywhere.

get.description: List all segment members. Data will be fetched from clickhouse database, using raw sql written on clickhouse db tables by matching segment dynamic conditions or matching user id of manual segment.

delete.description: Delete segment members in manual segment type.

get.description: Retrieve members metrics. Data should be retrieved from clickhouse database using raw sql.

parameters.description: enum field. any of (daily, weekly). default daily

post.description: Create a new webhook for the store. The response returns the newly created webhook configuration.

get.description: Paginated list of delivery attempts made across all webhooks. Supports optional filtering by `webhook_id` and `event_id`.
Fetch the original event payload and metadata, including all related delivery attempts.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the event to retrieve

get.description: Retrieve details of a single webhook by its ID.

put.description: Update an existing webhook by replacing all fields.

delete.description: Permanently delete a webhook by its ID.

200.description: Webhook deleted successfully. No content returned.

post.description: Manually retry a specific delivery log by re-sending the same payload to the configured webhook endpoint.

delivery_id.description: New delivery attempt ID for this replay

parameters.name: delivery_id
parameters.description: The ID of the delivery attempt to retry

post.description: Replay an existing event to a specific webhook. This triggers a new delivery with a fresh delivery_id.

delivery_id.description: New delivery attempt ID for this replay

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to replay

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook to send the replay to

post.description: Rotate the webhook's HMAC secret. The new secret is returned once and used to sign future webhook requests.

webhook_secret_key.description: The new HMAC secret key (only shown once)

post.description: Sends a test webhook to the configured callback URL. You may optionally provide a test payload.

delivery_id.description: New delivery attempt ID for this replay

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook to send a test to

BuyXGetYRuleBasedOnAmount.description:
Additional fields required in addition to marked as required.
1) buy_product_id or buy_variant_id or buy_from_category_id
2) get_product_id or get_variant_id or get_from_category_id
3) get_free_quantity or get_discount_percent

api_credentials.description: json object in key & value pair. Keys must match with params specified in required_credentials_params object (input_field_name).

cross_sell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

upsell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

CreateWarehouse.description:
Validations:

1) Either 'can_receive_stock' or 'accepts_returns' must be set to true.
2) 'can_receive_stock' cannot be set to false while the warehouse has existing inventory.
3) 'is_checkout_point' must be true when the warehouse type is 'retail-store'.
4) If 'can_receive_stock' is false then 'can_ship_parcel' and 'can_collect' fields should be false.
CreateWarehouse.title: CreateWarehouse

anonymous_id.description: in case user id is missing.

country_code.description: Two-letter code begin with a plus sign prefix that identifies different countries. By default it will be +91 if not provided.

phone.description: 10 digit phone number without country code.

gstin.description: Use in shipping details only for third party.

business_name.description: Use in shipping details only for third party.

is_default.description: first record will be treated as default if not changed.

points_earned.description: total points earned within the current loyalty program.

points_redeemed.description: total points redeemed within the current loyalty program.

total_spent.description: The total amount a customer has spent within the current loyalty program, excluding taxes, promotional discounts, and redeemed loyalty points. This value is used to determine tier eligibility and earning points calculation.

total_orders.description: The total number of completed orders counted in the current loyalty program.

lifetime_spent.description: The total amount a customer has spent across all time, regardless of loyalty program participation. This includes all completed orders and excludes taxes, promotional discounts, and redeemed points.

lifetime_orders.description: The total number of completed orders across all time, regardless of loyalty program.

date_of_join.description: The date and time when the customer first enrolled in the loyalty program.

date_of_assign.description: The date and time when the customer's current loyalty tier or program instance was assigned. This may change when tiers are upgraded, downgraded, or reassigned.

date_of_reset.description: The date and time when the customers current loyalty program cycle will reset, at which points earned, points redeemed, balance points, total spent, total orders will be cleared.

data.description: array of object. similar structure of metrics api, but actual keys will be decided by request payload.
array of object containing key-value data as per fields passed in query payload.
array of object containing key-value data as per fields, aggregate fields or group by fields passed in query payload.

events.description: optional. by default empty array will be returned if events are not required in filters.

attributes.description: optional. by default empty array will be returned if attributes are not required in filters.

segments.description: optional. by default empty array will be returned if segments are not required in filters.

minimum_quantity.description: It refers to the minimum quantity of a specific item a customer must purchase to qualify for the promotion.

maximum_quantity.description: It refers to the maximum quantity of a specific item a customer can purchase in order to qualify for the promotion. If this field is set to null, it indicates that there is no limit.

minimum_quantity.description: It refers to the minimum quantity of a specific item a customer must purchase to qualify for the promotion.

maximum_quantity.description: It refers to the maximum quantity of a specific item a customer can purchase in order to qualify for the promotion. If this field is set to null, it indicates that there is no limit.

maximum_purchase_amount.description: null means there is no limit.

maximum_quantity.description: null means there is no limit.

auto_scale.description:
The **auto_scale** key determines whether the promotion should be automatically adjusted based on the ratio between the quantities bought and the quantities received.

If **true**: The promotion will be applied dynamically according to the ratio of the buy quantity to the get quantity. For example, if the promotion is "Buy 2, Get 1" and the customer buys 4 items, they would receive 2 free items (scaling based on the original ratio).

If **false**: The promotion will be applied strictly according to the predefined conditions. For example, even if the customer buys more items, they will receive the fixed free quantity as defined in the original promotion (e.g., buying 4 would still only get them 1 free item).

quantity_condition.description: Defines how the system will evaluate the buy_quantity to determine if the promotion should be applied.
Defines how the system will evaluate the buy_quantity to determine if the promotion should be applied.

file.description: file attachment will be required or optional as per store setting.

renewal_type.description: frequency at which loyalty program will be renewed.

starts_at.description: If renewal_type is "custom", a corresponding valid date must be specified; for other types, the value should be null.

date_of_reset.description: If renewal_type is "custom", a corresponding valid date must be specified; for other types, the value should be null.

tier_upgrade_criteria.description: to decide tier upgradation based on no of orders or total purchase value

points_earning_type.description: Defines how points are earned. "dynamic" means points are calculated based on a rate (points_earning_rate), "fixed" means a fixed number of points are given.

total_spent_threshold.description: It should be null if tier upgrade criteria is total orders only.

total_orders_threshold.description: It should be null if tier upgrade criteria is total spent only.

points_earning_rate.description: The rate at which points are earned. For point earning type = dynamic

fixed_points.description: Fixed loyalty points for all orders. For point earning type = fixed

point_value.description: The monetary value of one loyalty point.

earn_points_with_promotion.description: Indicates whether customers can earn loyalty points on orders that have promotions applied.

redeem_points_with_promotion.description: Indicates whether customers can redeem loyalty points when placing orders that have promotions applied.

is_initial.description: only one tier will have value as True

segment_members.description:
accepts array of email ids. (valid emails only). 
 send null value if members list is empty or to remove all existing members.

maximum_weight.description: can be null if there is no limit on weight.

shipping_rate_fixed_price.description: can be null if shipping_rate_condition is provided.

shipping_rate_condition.description: can be null if shipping_rate_fixed_price is provided.

folder_id.description: Optional. If provided, file will be uploaded into the specified folder.
Optional. If provided, file will be uploaded into the specified folder.

used_in.description: section where file is used. e.g. product, campaign

used_in_reference_id.description: id of the reference object. e.g. product id, campaign id

NetbankingPayment.description: Payments using payment gateway netbanking option.
NetbankingPayment.title: NetbankingPayment

email.description: Indicates whether the user has opted to receive notifications via email.

sms.description: Indicates whether the user has opted to receive notifications via SMS.

whatsapp.description: Indicates whether the user has opted to receive notifications via WhatsApp.

NotificationPreferences.description: Set channel preferences for each type of

transactional.description: These notifications are typically critical for user engagement, providing updates, confirmations, or alerts related to their account activities.

promotional.description: These notifications aim to engage users with promotional content and enhance their overall experience with the platform.

newsletter.description: These notifications are often sent periodically as part of a subscription service.

NotificationPreferences.title: NotificationPreferences

id.description: Order id. Same as order number.

order_number.description: Unique number associated with the order.

order_date.description: Date and time when the order was placed.

status.description: Current status of the order (e.g., "pending," "processing," "shipped," etc.).

payment_status.description: Current payment status of the order (e.g., "pending," "success," "failed").

payment_success_date.description: Date and time when the payment for the order was successfully processed.

on_subscription.description: Indicates whether the order includes subscription items.

grand_total.description: Total amount for the order, including all items, taxes, and discounts.

loyalty_point_redeemed.description: Number of loyalty points redeemed in the order.

credit_balance_used.description: Amount of credit balance used in the order.

to_be_paid.description: Amount remaining to be paid for the order.

order_items_count.description: Total count of items included in the order.

OrderPaymentInfo.description: Common fields in all types of payments.
OrderPaymentInfo.title: OrderPaymentInfo

required_credentials_params.description: json object in key & value pair.

api_credentials.description: json object in key & value pair. Keys must match with params specified in required_credentials_params object (input_field_name).

Payment.description: Common fields in inbound and refund payments.
Payment.title: Payment

PaymentCommonFields.description: Common fields in inbound and refund payments.
PaymentCommonFields.title: PaymentCommonFields

minimum_quantity.description: It refers to the minimum quantity of a specific item a customer must purchase to qualify for the promotion.

maximum_quantity.description: It refers to the maximum quantity of a specific item a customer can purchase in order to qualify for the promotion. If this field is set to null, it indicates that there is no limit.

maximum_discount_amount.description: When a value is specified, the discount amount will not exceed the defined maximum, ensuring that the promotion stays within a controlled discount range. If this field is set to null, it indicates that there is no limit to the discount amount.

external_device_id.description: A unique ID issued by the Vendor.

is_busy.description: This field specifies the device is occupied for a transaction.

phone.description: 10 digit phone number without country code.

oneOf.description: string value for attribute type **text**, **single select** and **date**.
numeric value for attribute type number.

id.description: product id or combination of product id and variant id separated by hyphen.

variant_id.description: required only if product has_variant = true. otherwise it can be excluded or pass null.

update_other_variants.description: Can be used for the product having variants. if true, same inventry details will be updated to other variants which are not mentioned in request body.

variant_id.description: optional. can be null for non variant product.

vertical_rotation.description: Indicates whether items can be rotated during packing or if they must be kept in a strictly vertical orientation.

customer_group_id.description: customer group id. for different pricing model in case of multiple customer groups.

handling_charge.description: A handling charge is an additional fee applied to cover the costs associated with preparing, packaging, and processing an order for shipment or delivery.

Rounding.description: Define how to round the shipping cost
Rounding.title: Rounding

meta.description: meta data in key-value pair. example - [{"key":"value"}]

shipped_date.description: required if shipped_date is not updated yet for this shipment.

allowed_actions.description: dynamic values as per current status of the shipment.

packaging_optimisation_logic.description:
- cost - the lowest cost of shipment
- bins_utilization - max. utilization inside packing spaces
- bins_number - the smallest possible number of packing spaces

warehouse_id.description: optional. required only if location_priority = manual. Value should be array of warehouses ids.

default_weight.description: Specifies the default weight (in kilograms) used to calculate shipping costs when product packing details are missing. This value ensures that shipping estimates can still be generated in the absence of product packing information.

required_credentials_params.description: json object in key & value pair.

api_credentials.description: json object in key & value pair. Keys must match with params specified in required_credentials_params object (input_field_name).

activity.description: example - signup, order-confirmation, order-cancelled, order-refunded, cart-abandoned, etc.

content_title.description: to be used in email subject or notification heading if provided.

activity.description: example - signup, order-confirmation, order-cancelled, order-refunded, cart-abandoned, etc.

content_title.description: to be used in email subject, notification heading if provided.

retry_final_step_action.description: send null value for no action.

skip_next_interval_threshold.description: days before next shipment. required if skip_next_interval = true

is_product_price_include_tax.description:
This field indicates whether the product prices, handling charges already include applicable taxes.

- If set to true, the product prices are inclusive of tax, meaning no additional tax will be added during checkout.

- If set to false, taxes are excluded from the listed prices and will be calculated and added separately at checkout.

handling_charge_tax_rate.description: This represents the tax rate percentage applied specifically to handling charge in shipping. A handling charge is an additional fee applied to cover the costs associated with preparing, packaging, and processing an order for shipment or delivery.

file.description: file attachment will be required or optional as per store setting.

cross_sell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

upsell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

cross_sell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

upsell.description: Array of IDs. The ID value should be the product ID if a non-variant product is selected. For variant products, the ID should be a combination of the product ID and variant ID, separated by a hyphen ('-').

sku.description: variant sku. can be null for digital product.

slug.description: variant sku. can be null for digital product.

attribute_value.description: The attribute value can be represented as an array of strings for single-select attribute types. For color attribute types, the value will be represented as a color object, which contains color details with name and hexcode.

quantity_condition.description: This key defines how the system will evaluate the quantity to determine if the promotion should be applied, based on the specified slab.

Warehouse.description:
Validations:

1) Either 'can_receive_stock' or 'accepts_returns' must be set to true.
2) 'can_receive_stock' cannot be set to false while the warehouse has existing inventory.
3) 'is_checkout_point' must be true when the warehouse type is 'retail-store'.
4) If 'can_receive_stock' is false then 'can_ship_parcel' and 'can_collect' fields should be false.

is_checkout_point.description: this field will be always true for warehouse_type = retail-store.

Warehouse.title: Warehouse

webhook_secret_key.description: This will be shown only once during create. For all GET requests, this will be redacted.

delivery_id.description: The unique delivery_id for the Webhook delivery attempt

event_id.description: The unique id for that event. Shared across all delivery attempts of the same event.
The unique id for that event. Shared across all delivery attempts of the same event.
